Functions / Class Methods

A set of actions is called an activity and can be depicted as a diagram, where the actions are the nodes. Functions and class methods perform activities and each is thus associated to a certain diagram.

annotation

      type class::method(args){

      CODE 

      //$ action 1 description

      CODE

      //$ action 2 description
      
      CODE
      }

Any action annotated inside a method or function triggers that the corresponding diagram is drawn.

representation in the diagram

The full name of the method / function has to be retrieved by a C++ parser or equivalent.

examples


using namespace std;

int main() { 
//$ print «Hello World»
cout<<‘Hello World’;
return 0;
}
        

      
namespace Vincia {

bool VinciaShower::acceptTrial(Event& event){ 
//$ print «There is something about the way you look tonight»
cout<<‘There is something about the way you look tonight’;
return true;
}

}
